instructions:
Add salt to sifted flour and sift again. Combine slightly beaten egg yolk and water, and stir into flour
mixture. If dough is too dry to handle, add a few drops of water at a time. Do not add more water than is
necessary. Turn out on a lightly floured board and knead for about 5 minutes or until smooth. Form into a
ball, wrap in waxed paper and let stand 30 minutes.
Divide dough in 3 parts and roll each part until paper-thin. Fold each sheet of dough in thirds in jelly-roll
fashion and slice into 1/4 inch strips. Separate and straighten strips then lay out on waxed paper to dry for 4
hours. Serves 6. *(To store noodles, dry an additional 2 hours.)*

CHICKEN AND GRAVY
1 small roasting chicken or fryer, cut up
3 cups water
1/2 tsp salt
2 chicken bouillon cubes, divided
4 peppercorns
1 small onion
1 rib celery with leaves
3 carrots, halved
1/2 green pepper, quartered
1 can *(10 oz)* chicken broth, divided
1 pkg McCormick’s chicken gravy mix
1/2 cup flour

To a 6-quart pot add water, salt, 1 bouillon cube, peppercorns stuck in onion and celery. Bring to a boil
and add chicken pieces. Cover pot and simmer for 40 minutes. Skim off any foam. Strain and return broth
and chicken pieces to pot. Add carrots and green pepper, cover and continue simmering for an additional 20
minutes. Remove chicken, carrots and pepper to a platter and keep warm in oven.
Add gravy mix dissolved in 1/4 cup of canned chicken broth. Mix flour well with remaining canned
broth. Stir in flour mixture and cook till gravy is thick and bubbly.
Cook noodles about 15 minutes in 2 quarts of water with a bouillon cube. Drain well and add sufficient
gravy to generously coat noodles. Serve with the chicken, vegetables, mashed potatoes and gravy. 
*(Rev.
